cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles west of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northwest tonight and then curve north-northeast toward the Florida Big Bend, crossing the peninsula and moving into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River FL to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch: west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect (as of this advisory)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast (Big Bend to central peninsula) then Atlantic coast of GA/SC/NC
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with gusts well below tropical-storm force; peak sustained winds expected under 20 mph
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Mobile Bay from this system
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring periods of light to moderate rain; widespread heavy totals not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along Alabama beaches
